DOC.brief_summary: - There is no definite tool for measurement of dehydration in children - Subjective clinical dehydration scale is considered as valuable scoring system, but it cannot be reliable among clinicians sometimes. - Some authors found Inferior vena cava/Aorta ratio can be a objective marker for dehydration - However, there is no evidence of correlation between clinical dehydration scale and inferior vena cava/aorta ratio - We will observe correlation between clinical dehydration scale and inferior vena cava/aorta ratio and change of the ratio according to hydration with intravenous normal saline infusion.
DOC.brief_title: Ratio of Inferior Vena Cava and Aorta Diameter in Dehydrated Children
DOC.criteria: All children with dehydration who visit emergency department congenital heart disease bronchopulmonary dysplasia renal disease liver disease
